page.title: 17Children's Clubs
page.content: Children in our area have a splendid choice of clubs to join. For the energetic there is football, karate, horse-riding, swimming, gymnastics, badminton, judo and table-tennis. For the music lovers there is ballet, drama, majorettes, Morris dancing and music school. Every Wednesday Louise goes to music school. She plays the violin and she is studying for Grade 2. Every musician takes part in the choir practice, then they return to their particular instrument. The more traditional clubs include Guides, Scouts and Army Cadets. Rebecca belongs to the 3rd. S.W.F. company of Guides. She wears a red neck-tie with her blue uniform. She enjoys the outdoor life offered. There are long hikes followed by a cook-out and camps which offer many activities.
